Source code for app.user_interface

"""
.. moduleauthor:: Eugene Syriani
.. moduleauthor:: Florin Oncica 

.. versionadded:: 1.0

Created on Nov 09, 2016

This module represents the API of the application.
"""

from gui.app_interface import IApplication
from .manager import ReferenceManager
from .command import AddCommand, CommandExecutor, DeleteCommand, DuplicateCommand, ExportCommand, GenerateAllKeysCommand, ImportCommand, \
                    OpenCommand, PreviewCommand, SearchCommand, SortCommand, UndoCommand, UpdateCommand, ValidateAllCommand, ExportStringCommand
from .field_name import FieldName
from .bibtex_parser import BibTeXParser
from utils.settings import Preferences



[docs]class BiBlerApp(IApplication):
    """
    The main class that provides all the application functionalities.
    """

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(BiBlerApp, self).__init__()
        self.__manager = ReferenceManager()
        self.__executor = CommandExecutor()
        self.preferences = Preferences()

        

[docs]    def start(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.start`.
        """
        pass

        

[docs]    def exit(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.exit`.
        """
        pass

        

[docs]    def importFile(self, path, importFormat):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.importFile`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(ImportCommand(self.__manager, path, importFormat))

        

[docs]    def exportFile(self, path, exportFormat):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.exportFile`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(ExportCommand(self.__manager, path, exportFormat))

                

[docs]    def exportString(self, exportFormat):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.exportFile`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(ExportStringCommand(self.__manager, exportFormat))

        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.openFile`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(OpenCommand(self.__manager, path, openFormat))

        

[docs]    def addEntry(self, entryBibTeX, entryType = None):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.addEntry`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(AddCommand(self.__manager, entryBibTeX, entryType))

        

[docs]    def duplicateEntry(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.duplicateEntry`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(DuplicateCommand(self.__manager, entryId))

        

[docs]    def updateEntry(self, entryId, entryBibTeX):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.updateEntry`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(UpdateCommand(self.__manager, entryId, entryBibTeX))

        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.updateEntryField`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(UpdateCommand(self.__manager,entryId, entryBibTeX, fieldName, fieldValue))

        return self.__executor.execute(PreviewCommand(self.__manager, entryId))

        """

        """
        return self.__executor.execute(GenerateAllKeysCommand(self.__manager))

        

[docs]    def validateAllEntries(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.validateAllEntries`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(ValidateAllCommand(self.__manager))

        

[docs]    def undo(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.undo`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(UndoCommand(self.__executor))

    

[docs]    def hasUndoableActionLeft(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.hasUndoableActionLeft`.
        """
        return self.__executor.canUndo()

    

[docs]    def getEntryPaperURL(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getEntryPaperURL`.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            return entry.getFieldValue(FieldName.Paper)
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

        

[docs]    def search(self, query):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.search`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(SearchCommand(self.__manager, query))

        

[docs]    def sort(self, field, reverse=False):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.sort`.
        """
        return self.__executor.execute(SortCommand(self.__manager, field, reverse))

        

[docs]    def getEntry(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getEntry`.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            return entry.toEntryDict()
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

        

[docs]    def getContributors(self, entryId):
        """
        Get the contributors of an entry.
        :type entryId: :class:`int`
        :param entryId: The I{id} of the entry. 
        :rtype: :class:`list` of :class:`app.field.Contributor`
        :return: The contributors.
        :raises: Exception: If entry not found.
        :note: Contributors are not always the authors, they could be the editors or organizers.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            return entry.getContributors()
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

        

[docs]    def getBibTeX(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getBibTeX`.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            return entry.toBibTeX()
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

    

[docs]    def getEntryRequiredFields(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getEntryRequiredFields`.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            result=entry.iterRequiredFields()
            return result
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

    

[docs]    def getEntryOptionalFields(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getEntryOptionalFields`.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            result=entry.iterOptionalFields()
            return result
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

    

[docs]    def getEntryAdditionalFields(self, entryId):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getEntryAdditionalFields`.
        """
        entry = self.__manager.getEntry(entryId)
        if entry:
            result=entry.iterAdditionalFields()
            return result
        raise Exception('entry not found.')

        

[docs]    def getAllEntries(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getAllEntries`.
        """
        return [entry.toEntryDict() for entry in self.__manager.iterEntries()]

        

[docs]    def getEntryCount(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getEntryCount`.
        """
        return self.__manager.getEntryCount()

        

[docs]    def getSearchResult(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getSearchResult`.
        """
        return [entry.toEntryDict() for entry in self.__manager.iterSearchResult()]

        

[docs]    def getSearchResultCount(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.getSearchResultCount`.
        """
        return self.__manager.getSearchResultCount()

        

[docs]    def iterAllEntries(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.iterAllEntries`.
        """
        for entry in self.__manager.iterEntries():
            yield entry.toEntryDict()

        

[docs]    def iterSearchResult(self):
        """
        @see: :class:`gui.app_interface.IApplication.iterSearchResult`.
        """
        for entry in self.__manager.iterSearchResult():
            yield entry.toEntryDict()

    
    @staticmethod

[docs]    def formatBibTeX(self, bibtex):
        """
        Parses a BibTeX string, formats it according to the standard, and returns it.
        :type bibtex: :class:`str`
        :param bibtex: The BibTeX string.
        :rtype: :class:`str`
        :return: If parsed successfully, returns the formatted string, otherwise returns :class:`''`.
        :raises: Exception: If the provided BibTeX is invalid.
        @see: :class:`BibTeXParser` for supported formats.
        """
        return BibTeXParser(bibtex).parse().toBibTeX()
